summary: Email correspondence from a Victim Witness Coordinator at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, providing contact information for Safe Horizon mental health professionals to offer support and counseling to victims in the Epstein case. The email indicates a victim in Palm Beach reached out seeking counseling.

persons.name: Victoria Dexter
persons.role: VP, Mental Health Treatment at Safe Horizon
persons.context: Identified as a resource from Safe Horizon who can provide support and counseling to Epstein victims.

persons.name: Sherri Papamihalis
persons.role: Clinical Director â€” Counseling Center at Safe Horizon
persons.context: Identified as a clinical director at Safe Horizon's Counseling Center, with available slots for counseling Epstein victims; her phone number is provided.

events.title: Coordination for victim counseling
events.description: Email exchange regarding connecting Epstein victims with mental health counseling services through Safe Horizon.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Safe Horizon, through Victoria Dexter and Sherri Papamihalis, offered counseling services to victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
A victim in Palm Beach, Florida, contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office seeking counseling.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively coordinating victim support services in August 2019.
The correspondence shows post-arrest efforts to provide mental health resources to Epstein's victims.
